{{Infobox software | name = Liferay Portal | logo = Liferaylogo.png | logo size = 120px | screenshot = | developer = Liferay Inc | latest release version = 7.0.4 (7.0.4 GA5) | latest release date = {{release date|2017|10|23}} | status = Active | programming language = [[Java (programming language)|Java]] | operating system = [[Cross-platform]] | size = | genre = [[Enterprise portal]], [[content management framework]], [[content management system]], [[community]] | license = [[GNU Lesser General Public License|LGPL License]] [http://www.liferay.com/web/bryan.cheung/blog/-/blogs/liferay-adopting-the-lgpl-license] and proprietary<ref name="liferay">{{cite web |url=http://www.liferay.com/community/forums/-/message_boards/message/4882318 |title=Liferay 6.0 CE vs. EE licensing question |work=www.liferay.com |accessdate=2012-01-04 }}</ref> | website = {{URL|http://www.liferay.com}} }}
'''Liferay, Inc.''', is an open-source company that provides free documentation and paid professional service to users of its software. Mainly focused on [[enterprise portal]] technology, the company has its headquarters in [[Diamond Bar]], [[California]], [[United States]].
== History ==
Liferay's original product, Liferay Portal, was created in 2000 by [[chief software architect]] Brian Chan to provide an [[enterprise portal]] solution for [[non-profit organizations]].<ref>{{cite news |last=Howard |first=Phil |title=Liferay after Plumtree: Pure play portals alive and kicking |publisher=Reg Developer |date=October 18, 2005 |url=http://www.regdeveloper.co.uk/2005/10/18/pure_play_portal_alive_and_kicking/ }}</ref> In 2004, the company was incorporated under the name Liferay, Inc. and formalized its [[Germany]] subsidiary Liferay GmbH. In 2007, the company opened a new [[Asia]]n headquarters in [[Dalian]], [[China]], and the [[Spain|Spanish]] subsidiary Liferay SL. In March 2009, the company opened a new office in [[Bangalore]], [[India]]. To date Liferay has 21 offices worldwide with over 150 partners and 180,000 open source community members.{{Citation needed|date=April 2018}}
[[Sun Microsystems]] and Liferay signed a technology-sharing agreement during May 2008.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.liferay.com/web/guest/news/latest/-/blogs/1403796?_33_redirect=%2Fweb%2Fguest%2Fnews%2Flatest%3Fp_p_id%3D33%26p_p_lifecycle%3D0%26p_p_state%3Dnormal%26p_p_mode%3Dview%26p_p_col_id%3Dcolumn-3%26p_p_col_count%3D1%26_33_struts_action%3D%252Fblogs%252Fview%26_33_delta%3D10%26_33_keywords%3D%26_33_advancedSearch%3Dfalse%26_33_andOperator%3Dtrue%26cur%3D3 |title=Press Release: Sun Joins Liferay Open Source Community|date=May 2008}}</ref> Sun Microsystems rebranded the offering [[GlassFish]] Web Space Server. ZDNet further describes the relationship in the May 2008 article ''Sun and Liferay launch web-presentation platform''.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://news.zdnet.co.uk/software/0,1000000121,39412974,00.htm |title=Sun and Liferay launch web-presentation platform|date=May 2008}}</ref> In 2010 Sun was acquired by [[Oracle Corporation|Oracle]]<ref>{{cite web | url=http://news.cnet.com/8301-30685_3-20000019-264.html |title=Oracle buys Sun, becomes hardware company|date=January 27, 2010<!-- 6:55 AM PST-->}}</ref> and the GlassFish Web Space Server was not included in their portal roadmap, with all prospects turned over to Liferay, Inc.
In April 2013, Liferay partnered with [[TIBCO Software]] to offer a series of Liferay enterprise Connectivity Adapters (eC Adapters) that use TIBCO ActiveMatrix BusinessWorks with the intention of easing integration of Liferay Portal with multiple systems.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.cmswire.com/cms/information-management/enterprise-portal-liferay-partners-with-tibco-software-for-lower-cost-backend-integration-020698.php |title=Enterprise Portal Liferay Partners with TIBCO Software for Lower Cost Back-End Integration |work=www.cmswire.com |accessdate=2013-04-30 }}</ref>
In May 2016, Liferay introduced the Liferay Digital Experience Platform (DXP), a shift from simply portal software to a more comprehensive solution to manage customers and users.<ref>https://www.liferay.com/press-release?title=liferay-announces-a-platform-for-the-digital-enterprise</ref>
